bio: Co-Founder of @SeaLegacy/ Photographer / Speaker / Adventurer at National Geographic / Founder of ILCP/ SonyArtisan / #Amaze

list.comment: This #GivingTuesday, help us make an ocean of difference. We've set an ambitious goal to reach 1000 new @SeaLegacy Tide members to help fund bigger campaigns and support a greater diversity of solutions. Together, as a united voice for our oceans and the planet, we can make our impact even greater in vulnerable places like the Great Orca Fjords of Norway, where @SeaLegacy is seeking permanent protection for its marine species and habitats from oil exploration. Visit the link in my bio to help us #RaiseTheTide today and be sure to #follow SeaLegacy's stories all day as we celebrate The Tide's one year anniversary supporting healthy, abundant oceans.

It has been a bonanza for humpbacks this season in the great orca fjords of Norway and we have seen groups of as many as 20 animals herding fish and lunge-feeding together. Where there is an abundance of food, wildlife thrives! After experiencing a painful collapse of their herring fishery in the 1970s, Norway has become a leader in fisheries management. Today, there is a beautiful balance between fish, whales, tourism and fishermen. A true example for the rest of the world. #Norway

Photo by @michellevalbergphotography. As I inch towards 1 million followers, it is crystal clear to me that as the first female photojournalist to get this recognition, I must also recognize my sister warriors; the amazing women who deserve recognition and accolades for their creativity, bravery and perseverance. Their work, like mine is aimed at inspiring and informing and I hope you will be compelled to share their work with your network. I will share the work of 15 amazing photographers and first is my friend Michelle Valberg, one of Canada’s best wildlife photographers and a personal hero and role model.
*
*
On a remote island near Hall Beach, Nunavut in Canada's Arctic, we encountered approximately 10,000 walrus. Some were swimming and feeding, others were sprawled out on the beach. At the end of our shoot, we were walking back to our boat when we heard this thunderous sound. I turned and instinctively starting shooting. Everything happened so fast. It wasn't until I saw the back of my camera that I realized the magic that had just happened. The walrus were on the move into the water, they had been spooked. All the dust from the sandstone rose from the walrus craze, the sun peaked out slightly from the clouds, I had movement and the perfect storm to create this image. It remains one of my favourite wildlife images from the Arctic to date.
#walrus #nunavut #arctic #nikonambassador #canada #wildlife #canadianwildife #nature #raw #remoteisland #hallbeach #arcticcanada @stephsinclairpix @amivitale @aprilbencze @jennygnichols @morganheim @jodicobbphoto @maggiesteber @ascullyphoto @melissagroo @estherhorvath @beverlyjoubert @thedanielledasilva

As fog travels through the forest canopy of the Great Bear Rainforest, enveloping the stands of cedars and Douglas firs in a blanket of moisture, I am reminded of nature's resiliency. But even the most resilient have a limit and I am determined to protect this place and the animals that live within it.
@RaincoastConservation, in partnership with @CoastalFirstNations, is protecting the coastal carnivores of the Great Bear Forest through an auction of a collection of wildlife photographs to raise funds to acquired the commercial trophy hunting rights in approximately 30,000 square kilometres of BC’s Great Bear Rainforest. In doing so, they will extinguish guided hunting in that region. Visit the link in my bio to support this great cause.

A group of Gentoo penguins huddled in a snow storm to stay warm. Of all the different types of penguins, these to me, are the most entertaining. Their sassy curiosity and intelligent demeanour make them fun to photograph. Go to the link in my bio to read about how @natgeo and @sealegacy are using media to protect the #Antarctic. Shot on #assignment for @natgeo with @paulnicklen @andy_mann @Ladzinski @craigwelch @rodolfowerner and @sealegacy

Cold creeps into my core as I enter the dark water. Out of the edge of visibility I see the unmistakable black-and-white silhouette of an orca coming towards us. She is approaching fast and I must confess mixed feelings of excitement and fear as I fight to hold position. The small female swims quickly in between us….and drops a jellyfish between @paulnicklen and I. A jellyfish?? I have to wipe my mask to understand what I am looking at. The orca then disappears and comes back two minutes later to take back its jellyfish. Then she vanishes again into the dark water. Was this a gift, or perhaps a gesture of accomplishment, or maybe an invitation to play? What was this incredibly smart and beautiful animal trying to show us? I feel genuinely lucky to be alive and doing what I do and I hope that stories like this can ignite your imagination and spark in you the desire to fight with me to protect places like this. Join me and @SeaLegacy by going to the link on my bio. I would love to have you be a part of the large global community of engaged ocean advocates that is helping us in #TurningtheTide.

The news of no further movement on MPA creation in the #Antarctic is deeply disappointing, but not surprising. As long as we continue to prioritize politics and greed over existential survival, we will continue to delay the critical protections our oceans need if they are to survive. #CCAMLR #AntarcticNetworkNow #MarineProtectedAreas

We are here to photograph orcas as they feed on the vast schools of herring that overwinter here. For me, however, the mythical humpback whale holds a special fascination. Maybe it is the comeback story from the edge of extinction; the symbol of hope and resilience personified by a charismatic creature? I am not sure but they too are here, feeding in great, rambonctious numbers and they are beautiful. I hope to see many more humpbacks on this expedition. On the great orca fjords of Norway @SeaLegacy Expedition. #turningthetide #light

Happy thanksgiving! Take today to be thankful, empathetic and engaged in the world. I am grateful for the opportunity to work with like-minded organizations, to protect nature and Indigenous People. Help me celebrate this holiday by adding your voice to support the conservation of this beautiful region that is West Papua, link in bio.

The oceans need our help. Want to make a difference? Click on the link in my bio as we #RaiseTheTide today on #GivingTuesday. Four years ago, @sealegacy was a seedling of a dream for @paulnicklen and I. To be honest, we were scared by the amount of neglect and damage that we witnessed happening to our oceans and knew that we had to turn things around. We launched The Tide to help fund our vision and mission just one year ago and, in that time, this incredible community has proven to be absolutely critical to SeaLegacy’s work. To our Tide members, old and new, we truly couldn’t do it without you.

There are very few places on this planet where the adjective “pristine” can still be used. But both above and below the surface, that rings true for the Province of West Papua in Indonesia.  Not for much longer, though.  I photographed this young Papuan girl as she played in a forest stream while machines worked in the background to open new logging and mining roads. Even as we whisper with the hope of preserving it, bulldozers and trawlers are working to exploit the rich resources of this remote and beautiful corner of our planet. We can change how the story ends, though. This December we have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make sure its protected. Visit the link in my bio to learn how. 🇮🇩 #provinsikonservasi #protectwestpapua #TurningTheTide with @shawnheinrichs @indonesianoceanpride @conservationid @bluespherefoundation @sealegacy

There is no danger in swimming with orcas, except for the danger of falling in love with these intelligent, charismatic and mysterious creatures. The more time I spend with them above and below the water, the more empathy I feel for the challenges they face. Toxic accumulation of substances like PCBs that cause high mortality, captivity for entertainment, starvation due to overfishing, and even the fact that in some countries they are still hunted for food, not to mention a rapidly changing ocean chemistry! The Great Orca Fjords of Norway are a sanctuary for these animals; let's keep oil exploitation out of these beautiful fjords! #Lofoten #Solberg #NorwayOceanPride #Norway

I have never seen so many humpacks together in my life.! They hunt for herring in groups of 10 or more, raising their flukes high up in the air to propell themselves into the depths, where the fish hide during the daytime hours. As long as we keep oil out of these fjords, there is a chance that this amazing wildlife gspecatcle will go on into the future.

As an American and Mexican citizen living in Canada, I've reimagined the term SELFIE as: Someone Else is Likely Fixing It, Eh. It is something we all have thought at one point or another, but we, and the planet, cannot afford to continue to think this way. We have to hold ourselves accountable and empower those who propose real solutions. Today is the day to speak up and have your voices be heard. I've voted, have you? #vote #MidtermsMatter #MidtermElections #November6 #midterms2018

Photo: A mother grizzly bear watches over her cub, safe from the dangers of human intervention in the precious, protected area that is Katmai National Park and Preserve, Alaska.

One of the most important environmental and local empowerment laws of all time is inches away from the finish line, and we need all hands on deck to help the wonderful people there push it across. Click the link in my bio to show West Papua's parliament that you support the creation of the world's first Conservation Province. 🇮🇩 #provinsikonservasi #protectwestpapua #Indonesia #TurningTheTide with @sealegacy @bluespherefoundation @conservationid @shawnheinrichs #batman

Our faces are like a map of our lives. I photographed this warrior in a remote village in the Amazon during one of my first visits. The war paint, the feather headdress, the beautiful bead necklace and arm bands, tell the story of a brave and proud man. This portrait and many others are part of my new book, "Amaze". This weekend, I am proud to be offering a special Limited Edition of the book, presented in a beautifully crafted clamshell and including three fine art prints. The perfect holiday gift for a photography lover. Go to the link on my bio to learn more.

Around the world, as fish stocks are depleted, large predators like orcas, suffer. In British Columbia we are seeing them starve as herring stocks and therefore salmon stocks, dwindle. But sometimes it is just nature's course. This female orca I photographed in Norway is probably an old matriarch. Who knows how many oceans she has traveled and how many members of her pod she has birthed and mentored in the mysterious ways of the orca. #Follow @SeaLegacy as we explore ways to protect these northern fjords and turn them into a whale sanctuary where old whales can live and die in peace.

This is the kind of thing that takes your breath away: on the surface you just see fins coming and going, but when you put your head underwater, you see an “orca ballet”. The whole family works together as a team to corral the herring so that everyone can feed. There is no greed, there is no personal exceptionalism, there is no selfishness….if one orca wins, the whole family wins. Is there a lesson there for humans? #Lofoten #NorwayOceanPride #oilfreelofoten
A snowy petrel; poetry in motion. #Antarctica #peace

Photograph by my good friend @TimLaman, @BirdsofParadiseProject // A male Red Bird-of-Paradise displays for a female in the rainforest canopy of West Papua. This is one of the six Bird-of-Paradise species found only in the province of West Papua, Indonesia. Right now, we have a great chance to help ensure the future protection of this bird's home in West Papua’s incredibly rich rainforests as well as reefs.
Together with @bluespherefoundation, @ConservationOrg, and @IndonesianOceanPride, @SeaLegacy is standing alongside more than 700 local leaders and key Parliament members who are committed to making West Papua the world's first Conservation Province. Join us by adding your voice to the letter of support, link in @sealegacy ‘s bio. #ProvinsiKonservasi #ProtectWestPapua #TurningTheTide #BirdsofParadise

This week we are working with @_tomconlin , who pioneered the “soft in water encounter” with humpback whales to create a successful and ethical experience in the Dominican Republic. He is now working with experts and local authorities in the tiny island of Dominica to learn how the permanent population of sperm whales here might react to people in the water. Whale-based tourism is an important part of the economic recovery after the devastation of Hurricane Maria. In this photo, whale expert @susan_bird_ keeps a respectful distance from a family of sperm whales. What do you think? With @paulnicklen @perniero__hustlemode @sealegacy
#SoftInWaterEncounters #LoveWhales #EthicalTourism

Under the pink glow of morning light, we head out in search of orca pods in the Great Orca Fjords of Norway and the one thing I can tell you with complete certainty is that these animals are not just beautiful and fascintating; they are also funny, intelligent and playful. I shot this rambonctious male that took a crack at racing our boat, while standing #shoulder-to-shoulder with @PaulNicklen. Head to his profile to see how the two images compare! On expedition with @SeaLegacy to build support for the permanent moratorium of oil drilling in these fjords. #Magiclight @blackfish #LofotenDeclaration #Norway

The tropical rainforest in the mountains of Afark, West Papua, wakes up to a thick fog that travels through the canopy collecting moisture that will eventually rain elsewhere in the world. Rainforests are key to maintaining the conditions that make life on earth possible and play a key role in mitigating the effects of climate change. Please help me make sure it is protected by signing the petition in my bio. #ProvinsiKonservasi #protectwestpapua #turningthetide #indonesianoceanpride #papuabarat

I love collaborating with like-minded organizations and individuals who believe in the power of media to inspire real change. Last month, I joined @shawnheinrichs and @bluespherefoundation in West Papua, Indonesia. While there, they presented their new film, "Provinsi Konservasi", to audiences across the province, while also engaging key community leaders and influencers in workshops at each stop of the tour. All of this to garner support for the Papuan provincial legislation that would designate the region as a "Conservation Province.” This media, concert, and community outreach tour directly engaged and inspired more than 25,000 people and resulted in a petition signed by more than 700 local leaders in support of the proposed legislation.
The #ProvinsiKonservasi Initiative has the potential to bring about ridge-to-reef conservation of West Papua, setting a new gold standard for regional conservation and sustainable development and creating a blueprint for conservation initiatives that protect Earth’s most critical ecosystems. However, parliamentary leaders need our help to show the other members of parliament that the world is watching. We must deliver! Help #ProtectWestPapua by adding your name to our letter of support - link in bio. #TurningTheTide #ProtectWestPapua

I have the best followers in the world.  I cannot believe how quickly we have gotten our positive petition to protect West Papua to nearly 13, 000 signatures!  Let’s continue to congratulate and encourage West Papua’s leaders to take this initiative through the ballot and into law. Imagine if this entire province, covered by the world’s second largest rainforest and housing some of the richest reefs in the globe, was protected?  It wouldn’t just be a win for Indonesia, it would be a win for the world.  Won’t you help us get this to 30,000 signatures?  Click the link in my bio!! Photo: A boy from the Arfak Mountains plays his flute to the foggy valley below.

There is something really beautiful and magical about the quality of the light in the northern fjords of Norway. The sun rises and sets over a very short period of time and the orange hues of dawn, bleed into the bright pinks and purples of the sunset. It is during those precious minutes of light that we search for whales. With @sealegacy #Norge 🇳🇴

The large dorsal fin of a male orca cuts through the azure surface of the ocean in the early golden light. Today is our last day of shooting in the Great Orca Fjords of Norway. The hard job of making sure that law-makers, politicians and the Norwegian public get behind the idea of setting aside this place as a whale sanctuary, now begins. It will require all your support and your voices to make sure they know that the world wants and needs places where wild animals are allowed to live and die in peace. If Norway truly wants to be a leader in ocean conservation and climate change solutions, let them start by protecting their own. With @sealegacy #Norway #LofotenDeclaration

It’s my birthday today!! You can help me celebrate by supporting the important work I do with @sealegacy by becoming one of our amazing monthly donors. You can go to the link on my bio or tag a friend who shares our passion for protecting the oceans. My goal is to get 1000 new Tide monthly donors today!! Thank you! Together we are #TurningtheTide #happybirthdaytome

There are few places on this planet where the pulse of nature is so finely tuned as it is here. The return of the salmon to the rivers and creeks after their oceanic journey is the heartbeat that powers the people and wildlife on this coast, like this grizzly bear waiting for Coho salmon to go up the stream. But recently, we've seen its pulse weaken; there aren’t nearly as many fish as there once were, or should be. @PaulNicklen and our @SeaLegacy expedition team traveled the coast of BC this year to collect visuals that we hope will inspire dedicated people such as yourselves to maintain the health of this ecosystem.

Smudging is a practice that many indigenous people carry out to cleanse a space. I felt lucky and honored to witness the smudging of the Tsleil Waututh watchhouse; a space they built to resist the construction of the Trans Mountain pipeline. Today we woke up to the great news of a temporary block to the KeyStone pipeline. This certainly changes the dynamics for the Alberta tar sands and all the pipelines for Canada’s dirty oil that people from all corners of the world are opposing. Resisting matters, and it takes courage, time and resources. It is more important today than ever before, so please don’t give up! As young Kayah George took in the smoke from the smudge, I felt part of something bigger and more profound than myself. With @sealegacy #canada #britishcolumbia #firstnations #tsleilwaututh

When I feel a little fear, that is when I know that I am in the right place. The important question is - how do you channel that fear? I call all the little voices in my head, the 'Peanut Gallery,' and they are constantly telling me to be cautious, to stay in my comfort zone, to take the safe route. I make a constant effort to silence those voices. They are the voices that tell us that women don't deserve the same opportunities, or that the world is a dangerous place for a girl, or that we don't deserve the achievements we conquer. Whether I am making a speech or diving with large predators, I change my inner-dialogue into a conversation about empowerment. Fear is natural - it's how you use it that counts.

Wandering the charred landscape, a group of horses returns home after surviving the forest fire that swept through these mountains. When we worked on this story for @NatGeo, people thought it was a stretch to tie the worsening forest fires to the changes in precipitation brought forth by a warmer ocean. Our planet is changing faster than we are able to understand or prepare for. Anyone still denying climate change, should be held accountable by those already suffering its devastating consequences. #climatechangeisreal #forestfires #horses

Today and tomorrow, there is a unique opportunity to own a Limited Collector’s Edition of my new book, Amaze, at a discounted price. We are selling only 100 copies of this edition, produced with a clamshell cover, an autograph, a personalized note and three of my favourite limited edition 11x14 Fine Art prints, including The Lady and with the Goose, Fishing Girls, and this one of Ta'Kaiya Blaney - a special reserve from the series with Ta'Kaiya that is not included in the books. To purchase, visit the link in my bio.

Home to one of the world’s largest rainforests, the world’s largest mangrove forests, and the world’s most biodiverse reefs, reef-to-ridge West Papua is second to none. But the influx of palm oil, logging, mining, poorly-planned development, overfishing, destructive fishing, and the illegal wildlife trade are all threatening to irreversibly harm this magnificent place, and the many indigenous peoples that call it home. In the face of these seemingly insurmountable threats, the government and community of West Papua have haven joined together to stand in defence of their natural treasures. The fate of West Papua now rests in the adoption and implementation of revolutionary legislation that would establish all of West Papua as a conservation province.
Together, with @bluespherefoundation, @conservationid, and @indonesianoceanpride, @sealegacy is standing alongside more than 700 local leaders and key Parliament members who are committed to making West Papua the world's first Conservation Province, #ProvinsiKonservasi. Join us by adding your voice to our letter of support, see the link in my bio. #ProtectWestPapua

Spending time with Indigenous groups, like the Kayapo people of the Amazon, has taught me that abundance is not measured in the things that we own, but in the strength of our human spirit, and in the depth of our connection to the natural world. From the Amazon to the Arctic, Indigenous communities nurture an intimate awareness of the web of relationships that have sustained them in harmony with nature for millennia. Image from my new book Amaze, which encompasses two series: “Enoughness” and “The Water’s Edge.” Visit the link in my bio to own a Limited Collector’s Edition of Amaze with a clamshell cover, an autograph from me and three of my favourite limited edition, 11 x 14 Fine Art prints.

When it came time to select the image for the cover of my new book, Amaze, The Lady with the Goose was an obvious choice. This weekend, I am releasing a Collector’s Edition that includes an autographed copy of the book, beautifully packaged in a custom clamshell with three of my favourite 'Limited Edition Fine Art' prints, including The Lady with the Goose. Visit the link in my bio to find out more.

I am not sure how to describe today. @PaulNicklen and I spent most of the day in the company of a family of sperm whales and I am completely blown away. There is a huge difference between chasing whales and being let into a world I had no idea existed. As the family napped, traveled and socialized, we were allowed to be "flies on the wall “, intermittently resting and traveling, we never felt like intruders and instead we sat still while the whales came close to play, inspect and engage with the strange intruders in their world. Here I follow the fluke of a matriarch as she slowly takes the whole pod, including us, to a new napping location. #Lucky #HappyBirthdaytoMe @SeaLegacy #gratitude @omazeworld

Our mission @SeaLegacy is to foster a global movement for healthy and abundant oceans. After five years, this community - of ocean citizens from around the world - continues to grow, leaving a powerful and passionate imprint on the globe. I’m proud to be #TurningTheTide with you and excited to announce that new items will be in available in the @SeaLegacy store next week. Every purchase directly supports our efforts to protect our oceans. Gear up with our casual expedition hats & shirts or our new reusable water bottles, bento boxes, & bamboo cutlery to fight plastic pollution! Which ones are you most excited for?
Photo: A loggerhead sea turtle and its companion ride the warm waters of the gulf stream off the Azores.
